snippet: The depletion of large parts of the ice sheet in West Antarctica is almost certainly unstoppable, with global warming accelerating the disintegration, two groups of scientists reported Monday.
abstract: Two groups of scientists report in journals Science and Geophysical Research Letters that a large section of West Antarctica ice sheet has begun falling apart, partially fueled by global warming from greenhouse gases, and its continued melting appears unstoppable; if findings hold up, they suggest the melting could destabilize neighboring parts of ice sheet and rise in sea level of 10 feet or more may be unavoidable in coming centuries.

byline.original: By JUSTIN GILLIS and KENNETH CHANG

lead_paragraph: The depletion of large parts of the ice sheet in West Antarctica is almost certainly unstoppable, with global warming accelerating the disintegration, two groups of scientists reported Monday.

headline.main: Scientists Warn of Rising Oceans From Polar Melt
headline.print_headline: Scientists Warn of Rising Oceans From Polar Melt
